definition: to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards
unable to discipline a child/incapable of dealing with (unruly child)

sentences.english: And then having Him chasten and correct you as His child.
sentences.chinese: 然後讓神來象對兒女一樣潔淨你，管教你。

sentences.english: You'd speak to your little son;he's too mischievous.
sentences.chinese: 你得管教一下你的小兒子了，他也太淘氣啦。

sentences.english: Power stone out of the first penitentiary.
It is very difficult to teach English in junior middle school.
sentences.chinese: 唯初中學生與五歲小孩難於管教，各位以爲然否？

sentences.english: No doubt about it, disciplining our kids takes time and energy.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，管教孩子需要耗費時間和精力。

sentences.english: He later found work as a psychologist at a youth correctional facility.
sentences.chinese: 後來在一家少年管教所擔任心理醫生。

sentences.english: A parent relinquishes control over his grown children.
sentences.chinese: 父親不再管教已經長大的孩子。

sentences.english: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
sentences.chinese: 愚蒙迷住孩童的心，用管教的杖可以遠遠趕除。

sentences.english: Christ administers His discipline through Spirit-filled men.
sentences.chinese: 基督藉著用聖靈充滿的人，來管教信徒。

sentences.english: They must neither over-discipline nor neglect their children.
sentences.chinese: 他們既不應管教過嚴，也不該忽略管教子女。

sentences.english: They must neither over-discipline nor neglect their children.
sentences.chinese: 他們既不應管教過嚴，也不該忽略管教子女。

sentences.english: I will chasten them according to the report given to their assembly.
sentences.chinese: 我必按他們會衆所聽見的，管教他們。

sentences.english: You hate my instruction and cast my words behind you.
sentences.chinese: 其實你恨惡管教，將我的言語丟在背後。

sentences.english: Guilt-ridden, parents then indulge their children with gifts and indiscipline .
sentences.chinese: 負疚的雙親用禮物和放鬆管教來遷就孩子。

sentences.english: Too rigid parental control fosters rebellion in children.
sentences.chinese: 父母管教過嚴會促使子女反抗。

sentences.english: Disciplining children is another area that American parents have differing opinions about.
sentences.chinese: 管教孩子是美國父母有意見分歧的另一個方面。

definition: to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
